    • Capterra offers objective, independent research and verified user reviews. We may earn a referral fee when you visit a vendor through our links.

    Independent research methodology

    Capterra’s researchers use a mix of verified reviews, independent research and objective methodologies to bring you selection and ranking information you can trust. While we may earn a referral fee when you visit a provider through our links or speak to an advisor, this has no influence on our research or methodology. Learn more

    How Capterra verifies reviews

    Capterra carefully verified over 2.5 million+ reviews to bring you authentic software and services experiences from real users. Our human moderators verify that reviewers are real people and that reviews are authentic. They use leading tech to analyze text quality and to detect plagiarism and generative AI. Learn more

    How Capterra ensures transparency

    Capterra lists all providers across its website—not just those that pay us—so that users can make informed purchase decisions. Capterra is free for users. Software and service providers pay us for sponsored profiles to receive web traffic and sales opportunities. Sponsored profiles include a link-out icon that takes users to the provider’s website. Learn more

reviews.title: dialog
reviews.review_text:
>Cons

Occasional lags are there when I process large data sets which I feel is a downside. Also, ETL feature is missing in Google looker which I find disappointing as it should be already there.
reviews.pros: My most liked feature of google looker is LookML which has been a great helped me made complex data relationships easier and saved me a lot of time. Moreover, looker has a plethora of customizable visualizations which also has ability to add advanced drill down to make it more interactive. Also, with google looker reports can be delivered by specific schedules.
reviews.cons: Occasional lags are there when I process large data sets which I feel is a downside. Also, ETL feature is missing in Google looker which I find disappointing as it should be already there.

>Cons

Some dependencies and performance issues; can be difficult to manage, and visualization is quite limited.
reviews.pros: Looker provides the real-time data with great support and customization. Fine tool for collaboration.
reviews.cons: Some dependencies and performance issues; can be difficult to manage, and visualization is quite limited.

reviews.pros: The fact that I can connect more data sources, is saves me a lot of time as data is imported automatically. Also the ability to share the reports with a simple link is another useful feature.
reviews.cons: At the beginning it seems that is very difficult to setup all the charts needed.

It isn't easier for some one new to get used to looker because of its steep learning curve. Compared to Tablue, looker feels a bit limited at times
reviews.pros: You can create your own reporting dashbaords, that's one of the reliable functionality I really look up on from this software. For some one who doesn't have SQL knowledge its a lot easier to make number talk the visualization part.
reviews.cons: It isn't easier for some one new to get used to looker because of its steep learning curve. Compared to Tablue, looker feels a bit limited at times

reviews.title: typo-0 text-neutral-90
reviews.review_text:
>Cons

In the free version, I hope for future updates that Looker Studio will offer the capability to establish connections with PostgreSQL databases through SSH or VPN
reviews.pros: What truly stands out for me with Looker Studio is its user-friendly interface and the seamless integration with Google connectors. This pre-built connection to link your data from Google Sheets to the platform simplifies the process significantly. Once the data is linked, creating customized dashboards featuring a variety of graphs is a breeze, allowing you to tailor them to your company's color scheme and preferences
reviews.cons: In the free version, I hope for future updates that Looker Studio will offer the capability to establish connections with PostgreSQL databases through SSH or VPN

reviews.title: flex items-center gap-1
reviews.review_text:
>Cons

Looker is still growing and that means he still doesn’t have the capacity to sync with every tool on the market. So, my only least-liked topic about it will be that.
reviews.pros: Looker is your tool if you're looking for a tool that allows you to create detailed dashboards while being user-friendly, visually attractive, and easy to use. Everything you need when it comes to data, Looker has a solution that will allow you to build great databases and dashboards that will help all business units plan, strategize, and operationalize. There's no better tool in the market.
reviews.cons: Looker is still growing and that means he still doesn’t have the capacity to sync with every tool on the market. So, my only least-liked topic about it will be that.

reviews.title: flex items-center gap-1
reviews.review_text:
>Cons

The flexibility and customization options in Looker Studio can be both a strength and a weakness. While it allows for tailored analytics solutions, it can also be complex to set up intricate data models and dashboards, requiring a higher level of technical expertise.
reviews.pros: Looker Studio's standout features is its robust data modeling capabilities. The ability to create and customize data models is crucial in tailoring analytics to meet specific business needs. Looker Studio makes this process remarkably straightforward, empowering users to build complex models with ease. This flexibility ensures that you can derive insights that are truly relevant to your organization.
reviews.cons: The flexibility and customization options in Looker Studio can be both a strength and a weakness. While it allows for tailored analytics solutions, it can also be complex to set up intricate data models and dashboards, requiring a higher level of technical expertise.

reviews.title: flex items-center gap-1
reviews.review_text:
>Cons

The support team is close to nonexistent and there aren't many support resources that explain how to do complex tasks with it.
reviews.pros: Reports and dashboards are extremely simple to set up with Looker. It removed our need to ask for data all the time because it doesn't require much technical knowledge to be able to learn how to use it and we can all quickly fetch and chart most data with it on our own.
reviews.cons: The support team is close to nonexistent and there aren't many support resources that explain how to do complex tasks with it.

reviews.title: !mt-4 space-y-6
reviews.review_text:
>Cons

The support team is close to nonexistent and there aren't many support resources that explain how to do complex tasks with it.
reviews.pros: Reports and dashboards are extremely simple to set up with Looker. It removed our need to ask for data all the time because it doesn't require much technical knowledge to be able to learn how to use it and we can all quickly fetch and chart most data with it on our own.
reviews.cons: The support team is close to nonexistent and there aren't many support resources that explain how to do complex tasks with it.

reviews.title: flex items-center gap-1
reviews.review_text:
>Cons

The new interface of swapping between read-only and developer is not that great. The older version was better as compared to the new one. Customer support is gone from good to bad. When I had queries , customer support team could not help as they themselves were not aware of the tool and also they share articles which are available with google search to diagnose.The codes should have an option to export to PDF.
reviews.pros: First and foremost, the most important feature of Looker is, it is cloud based BI tool which can be accessed remotely and easy to work unless like other tools where it requires to be installed in the PC.It has clean and simple UI which is very to build dashboards and reports.Lookml option provides benefit of flexibility in code which in turn help to create own metrics and create calculations. This helps for the marketer or developer to have the control of the metrics Data modelling is very easy to create and Looker has the capacity to sync with various connectors to access the data from other sources, which solves the use case of having 3rd party connectors.
reviews.cons: The new interface of swapping between read-only and developer is not that great. The older version was better as compared to the new one. Customer support is gone from good to bad. When I had queries , customer support team could not help as they themselves were not aware of the tool and also they share articles which are available with google search to diagnose.The codes should have an option to export to PDF.
